moves.2... d6: My opponent defends his e5 pawn.
moves.3. fxe5: I take the e5 pawn trying to open the center a bit and also setting up my next move.
moves.3... dxe5: My adversary recaptures the e5 pawn.
moves.4. Nf3: I attack the e5 pawn with my kingside knight
moves.4... Bg4: Kradwan defends the e5 pawn by pinning my knight to my queen.
moves.6. Qxf3: I recapture with my queen setting up a possible checkmate.
moves.6... Qf6: My opponent challenges my queen with his queen.
moves.7. O-O: I castle and move a rook in to backup my queen.
moves.8. Rxf3: I recapture the queen with my rook.
moves.8... Nf6: Black develops a knight and protects the f7 pawn.
moves.9. d3: I protect my e4 pawn and open up the c1-h6 diagonal for my dark square bishop.
moves.9... h6: Black tries to limit my bishops movements on that diagonal.
moves.10... Bc5+: Black checks my king and develops a bishop.
moves.11. Be3: I protect the king and develop my queenside bishop.
moves.11... Nbd7: Kradwan develops another knight to a position where he can protect his bishop.
moves.12. a3: I move up my a2 pawn with the intention of moving my b2 pawn next.
moves.12... O-O: Black castles and connects his rooks.
moves.13. Bxc5: I take out the bishop becase i see that his knight would be in a poor position after retaking my bishop.
moves.13... Nxc5: My opponent recaptures my bishop with his knight.
moves.14. Rg3: I try to put some pressure on my opponents king.
moves.14... c6: Black moves up the c7 pawn to c6 to curtail my knights movements.
moves.15. Rf1: I move the rook over to try to steal a knight on my next move.
moves.15... Nh5: Black hops the knight to safety and attacks my other rook.
moves.16. Rg4: I move the rook out of danger.
moves.16... Nf4: Black hops his knight into a more convenient location.
moves.17. b4: I try to persuade his other knight to retreat.
moves.17... Nd7: And lo and behold it does retreat.
moves.18. Rg3: I move my rook to a more secure location.
moves.18... Kh8: Black decides to move his king to a better location.
moves.19. b5: I try to make some maneuvering room for my pieces.
moves.20. Bxb5: I recapture the pawn with my bishop and attack his knight.
moves.20... Nf6: The knight skidaddles out of harms way.
moves.21. Nd5: I blundered here moving my knight from its location where it was protecting the e2 square.
moves.21... Nf6xd5: My opponent doesn't seem to see my blunder and captures my forward knight.
moves.22. exd5: I recapture his knight with a pawn.
moves.22... f6: Black moves a pawn forward and protects his e5 pawn.
moves.23. d4: I move up a pawn so my bishop protects me from my previous blunder while trying to loose his knights protection.
moves.23... a6: Kradwan attacks my bishop with a pawn and tries to move my bishop off its protective diagonal.
moves.24. dxe5: I try to exchange knight for bishop by removing his knights protection.
moves.24... fxe5: Black recaptures and protects the knight.
moves.25. Bd3: I am forced to move here to protect from the knight fork on my king and rook.
moves.25... Nxd3: Black exchanges his knight for my bishop.
moves.26. Rxd3: I recapture with my rook trying to leave my pawn structure intact.
moves.27... b5: Black advances a pawn to a better location.
moves.29. Ke2: I also move up my king.
moves.31. d7: I move my pawn near the back rank.
moves.31... Rd8: Black move his rook in to protect from my pieces promotion.
moves.32... Rxd7: Black takes out the pawn with his rook.
moves.34... Kc6: Black moves his king over to that side.
moves.35. Kd4: I move back to protect my pawns.
moves.36. c3: I move my pawn forward to stifle his advances.
moves.36... a4: Black moves a pawn forward and commits to this side of the board.
moves.37. g4: I move my pawns into better position on the other side of the board.
moves.38. h4: I move up the other pawn into better position.
moves.38... Kb6: Black blunders here but I am unaware of it.
moves.39. Kd5: I move to block his king in.
moves.39... g5: Black moves a pawn on the other side of the board.
moves.41... Ka6: I should not have accepted the draw offer because I could have forced him to move a pawn or move away from his pawns here.
